channel.title: Yahoo News - Latest News & Headlines

item.title: ISIL may be planning terror attacks on US homeland
item.description: Exclusive: Well-armed group may have America in its cross-hairs.
item.media:text: Exclusive: Well-armed group may have America in its cross-hairs.

item.title: Israel prepares for 'next big battle'
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — With the Gaza war seeming to have calmed, Israel is now preparing for its next big battle: a diplomatic and legal challenge over Palestinian civilian deaths in its campaign against Hamas militants.
item.media:text: JERUSALEM (AP) — With the Gaza war seeming to have calmed, Israel is now preparing for its next big battle: a diplomatic and legal challenge over Palestinian civilian deaths in its campaign against Hamas militants.

item.title: More Cubans risking life and limb to get to US
item.description: MIAMI (AP) — Coast Guard officials and social workers are seeing many more Cubans risk their lives on homemade rafts to reach the U.S. this year.
item.media:text: MIAMI (AP) — Coast Guard officials and social workers are seeing many more Cubans risk their lives on homemade rafts to reach the U.S. this year.

item.title: Judge slaps down McDonnell request
item.description: By Gary Robertson RICHMOND Va. (Reuters) - A federal judge on Friday rejected defense motions that former Virginia Governor Robert McDonnell and his wife be acquitted in their corruption and bribery trial. U.S. District Judge James Spencer turned down the bids after a one-hour hearing. The motions came after prosecutors wrapped up their case against McDonnell, a Republican, and his wife after almost three weeks of testimony. Defense lawyers are expected to start calling witnesses on Monday.
item.media:text: By Gary Robertson RICHMOND Va. (Reuters) - A federal judge on Friday rejected defense motions that former Virginia Governor Robert McDonnell and his wife be acquitted in their corruption and bribery trial. U.S. District Judge James Spencer turned down the bids after a one-hour hearing. The motions came after prosecutors wrapped up their case against McDonnell, a Republican, and his wife after almost three weeks of testimony. Defense lawyers are expected to start calling witnesses on Monday.

item.title: Ukraine says it's destroyed Russian military vehicles
item.description: KAMENSK-SHAKHTINSKY, Russia (AP) — Russian military vehicles crossed into Ukraine during the night, NATO and Ukraine said Friday, and the Ukrainian president said most of them were quickly destroyed by his troops.
item.media:text: KAMENSK-SHAKHTINSKY, Russia (AP) — Russian military vehicles crossed into Ukraine during the night, NATO and Ukraine said Friday, and the Ukrainian president said most of them were quickly destroyed by his troops.

item.title: Dire Ebola update from WHO
item.description: The death toll from the worst ever outbreak of Ebola has risen to 1,145, the World Health Organization said on Friday, as 76 new deaths were reported in the two days to August 13 in the four West African nations affected by the epidemic. The U.N. health agency said that a total of 152 confirmed, probable and suspected new cases of the deadly hemorrhagic fever were reported in the two day period in Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria and Sierra Leone, bringing the total for the outbreak to 2,127.
item.media:text: The death toll from the worst ever outbreak of Ebola has risen to 1,145, the World Health Organization said on Friday, as 76 new deaths were reported in the two days to August 13 in the four West African nations affected by the epidemic. The U.N. health agency said that a total of 152 confirmed, probable and suspected new cases of the deadly hemorrhagic fever were reported in the two day period in Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria and Sierra Leone, bringing the total for the outbreak to 2,127.

item.title: EU's crucial move to save Iraq from "true catastrophe"
item.description: Brussels (AFP) - EU ministers agreed at an emergency meeting on Friday to back the arming of overwhelmed Iraqi Kurd fighters in the face of an onslaught by Islamic State jihadists.
item.media:text: Brussels (AFP) - EU ministers agreed at an emergency meeting on Friday to back the arming of overwhelmed Iraqi Kurd fighters in the face of an onslaught by Islamic State jihadists.

item.title: Teen shot by cop suspect in robbery: Police
item.description: St. Louis suburb's police chief ID'd officer, alleged teen killed after robbery.
item.media:text: St. Louis suburb's police chief ID'd officer, alleged teen killed after robbery.

item.title: Massive Revolutionary War artifact find
item.description: LAKE GEORGE, N.Y. (AP) — An archaeological dig at a Colonial military site in the southern Adirondacks of New York has turned up thousands of artifacts, from butchered animal bones to uniform buttons, along with a lime kiln used to make mortar for a British fort that was never completed.
item.media:text: LAKE GEORGE, N.Y. (AP) — An archaeological dig at a Colonial military site in the southern Adirondacks of New York has turned up thousands of artifacts, from butchered animal bones to uniform buttons, along with a lime kiln used to make mortar for a British fort that was never completed.

item.title: Va. deputy shot daughter, crashed car, say police
item.description: WINCHESTER, Va. (AP) — Authorities say a Virginia deputy sheriff shot his 16-year-old daughter after mistaking her for an intruder, then crashed his car as he rushed her to the hospital.
item.media:text: WINCHESTER, Va. (AP) — Authorities say a Virginia deputy sheriff shot his 16-year-old daughter after mistaking her for an intruder, then crashed his car as he rushed her to the hospital.

item.title: NASCAR tells drivers to stay in cars in wake of fatal crash
item.description: (Reuters) - NASCAR on Friday said it would forbid drivers from getting out of their cars during caution periods following an on-track fatality last weekend when three-time champion Tony Stewart struck another driver. The most widely followed motorsports organization in the United States said the new rule would require drivers involved in accidents to remain in their car unless it was unsafe to do so due to fire or smoke. A track safety official would then direct the driver to leave the car and walk directly to an ambulance or other vehicle. The new rule puts into the books something that had "been informal, just an understanding," said Robin Pemberton, NASCAR's vice president of competition and racing development.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - NASCAR on Friday said it would forbid drivers from getting out of their cars during caution periods following an on-track fatality last weekend when three-time champion Tony Stewart struck another driver. The most widely followed motorsports organization in the United States said the new rule would require drivers involved in accidents to remain in their car unless it was unsafe to do so due to fire or smoke. A track safety official would then direct the driver to leave the car and walk directly to an ambulance or other vehicle. The new rule puts into the books something that had "been informal, just an understanding," said Robin Pemberton, NASCAR's vice president of competition and racing development.

item.title: Tennis - Benneteau stuns Wawrinka to reach semi-finals
item.description: - France's Julien Benneteau won 12 of the last 15 games to stun Australian Open champion Stan Wawrinka 1-6, 6-1, 6-2 and make the Cincinnati Masters semi-finals on Friday.
item.media:text: - France's Julien Benneteau won 12 of the last 15 games to stun Australian Open champion Stan Wawrinka 1-6, 6-1, 6-2 and make the Cincinnati Masters semi-finals on Friday.

item.title: Agent gives Hollywood edgy look with 'real' people
item.description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. (AP) — You couldn't miss Hollywood talent agent Sid Levin's office in the old days: It wasn't much bigger than a closet and it was sometimes filled with burglars, bank robbers and gang members, all trying to break into the movies.
item.media:text: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. (AP) — You couldn't miss Hollywood talent agent Sid Levin's office in the old days: It wasn't much bigger than a closet and it was sometimes filled with burglars, bank robbers and gang members, all trying to break into the movies.

item.title: Browns hope to name starting QB on Tuesday
item.description: CLEVELAND (AP) — Browns coach Mike Pettine has set Tuesday as his target date. That's when he'll say whether Brian Hoyer or rookie Johnny Manziel is the starting quarterback for the opener.
item.media:text: CLEVELAND (AP) — Browns coach Mike Pettine has set Tuesday as his target date. That's when he'll say whether Brian Hoyer or rookie Johnny Manziel is the starting quarterback for the opener.

item.title: Philadephia schools to open on time, but some cuts announced
item.description: Superintendent William Hite announced on Friday that the Philadelphia School District will open on time, but some cuts were announced amid a budget crisis.
item.media:text: Superintendent William Hite announced on Friday that the Philadelphia School District will open on time, but some cuts were announced amid a budget crisis.

item.title: FIFA WCup study praises risk-taking, fast breaks
item.description: GENEVA (AP) — Risk-taking and counterattacks are the new fashion in football, according to a FIFA study of World Cup teams' tactics.
item.media:text: GENEVA (AP) — Risk-taking and counterattacks are the new fashion in football, according to a FIFA study of World Cup teams' tactics.

item.title: Stopping Cybercrime from the Inside Out
item.description: Cybercrime today works as a sophisticated, global network that combines traditional crime and cybercrime to infiltrate networks and generate devastating breaches to companies. Businesses must improve cybersecurity to combat the changing landscape of today’s cybercrime.

item.title: Woman tested for Ebola in Scotland
item.description: A woman who fell ill at an immigration facility centre in Scotland is being tested for the Ebola virus, health officials said Friday. "We are currently investigating a possible case" of Ebola, the spokesman said. The Ebola outbreak has so far claimed more than 1,000 lives in Sierra Leone, Guinea, Liberia and Nigeria.
item.media:text: A woman who fell ill at an immigration facility centre in Scotland is being tested for the Ebola virus, health officials said Friday. "We are currently investigating a possible case" of Ebola, the spokesman said. The Ebola outbreak has so far claimed more than 1,000 lives in Sierra Leone, Guinea, Liberia and Nigeria.

item.title: England bowl India out for 148
item.description: LONDON (AP) — Mahendra Singh Dhoni was caught at long leg by Chris Woakes off the bowling of Stuart Broad as England bowled India out for 148 on day one of the fifth test at the Oval on Friday.
item.media:text: LONDON (AP) — Mahendra Singh Dhoni was caught at long leg by Chris Woakes off the bowling of Stuart Broad as England bowled India out for 148 on day one of the fifth test at the Oval on Friday.

item.title: U.S. doctor with Ebola hopes to leave hospital soon: aid group
item.description: WINSTON-SALEM N.C. (Reuters) - The Texas doctor being treated for Ebola in Atlanta has continued to improve and hopes to be released "in the near future," the Christian relief organization he worked for in West Africa said. Kent Brantly, 33, was one of two U.S. aid workers who were infected with the deadly virus in Liberia and evacuated earlier this month for treatment at Emory University's hospital as their health declined. "Dr. Kent Brantly is doing very well and hopes to be released sometime in the near future," Franklin Graham, president of North Carolina-based Samaritan's Purse, said in a Facebook post on Thursday. Nancy Writebol, a 59-year-old missionary from Charlotte, North Carolina, also remains hospitalized in Atlanta.
item.media:text: WINSTON-SALEM N.C. (Reuters) - The Texas doctor being treated for Ebola in Atlanta has continued to improve and hopes to be released "in the near future," the Christian relief organization he worked for in West Africa said. Kent Brantly, 33, was one of two U.S. aid workers who were infected with the deadly virus in Liberia and evacuated earlier this month for treatment at Emory University's hospital as their health declined. "Dr. Kent Brantly is doing very well and hopes to be released sometime in the near future," Franklin Graham, president of North Carolina-based Samaritan's Purse, said in a Facebook post on Thursday. Nancy Writebol, a 59-year-old missionary from Charlotte, North Carolina, also remains hospitalized in Atlanta.

item.title: EU says status quo for Gaza 'not an option'
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — The European Union offered Friday to take charge of Gaza's border crossings and work to prevent illegal arms flows, insisting on a durable truce and saying a return to the status quo for the region "is not an option."
item.media:text: CAIRO (AP) — The European Union offered Friday to take charge of Gaza's border crossings and work to prevent illegal arms flows, insisting on a durable truce and saying a return to the status quo for the region "is not an option."

item.title: A seminary behind bars seeks to change Texas prison system
item.description: By Jon Herskovitz ROSHARON Texas (Reuters) - In a solitary confinement unit at a maximum-security prison in Texas, convicted murderer Troup Foster offers spiritual guidance to offenders as a part of a program designed to spark a cultural change in the country's largest prison system. Foster, 52, is one of 34 offenders in the first class of a university seminary school set up at the state's Darrington Unit. "For me, I am probably going to die here." The Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary, a private college based in Fort Worth, Texas, began its bachelor of science in biblical studies program at Darrington, south of Houston, about three years ago.
item.media:text: By Jon Herskovitz ROSHARON Texas (Reuters) - In a solitary confinement unit at a maximum-security prison in Texas, convicted murderer Troup Foster offers spiritual guidance to offenders as a part of a program designed to spark a cultural change in the country's largest prison system. Foster, 52, is one of 34 offenders in the first class of a university seminary school set up at the state's Darrington Unit. "For me, I am probably going to die here." The Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary, a private college based in Fort Worth, Texas, began its bachelor of science in biblical studies program at Darrington, south of Houston, about three years ago.

item.title: India 148 all out against England
item.description: India, after losing the toss, were bowled out for 148 on the first day of the fifth Test against England at The Oval on Friday. Mahendra Singh Dhoni, the India captain, top-scored with 82 before he was last man out after pulling Stuart Broad to Chris Woakes at long leg. Ishant Sharma was seven not out, having batted for over an hour while helping Dhoni added 58 for the last wicket in the largest partnership of the innings. As in their innings and 54-run defeat in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, India lost five wickets before lunch on the first day.
item.media:text: India, after losing the toss, were bowled out for 148 on the first day of the fifth Test against England at The Oval on Friday. Mahendra Singh Dhoni, the India captain, top-scored with 82 before he was last man out after pulling Stuart Broad to Chris Woakes at long leg. Ishant Sharma was seven not out, having batted for over an hour while helping Dhoni added 58 for the last wicket in the largest partnership of the innings. As in their innings and 54-run defeat in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, India lost five wickets before lunch on the first day.

item.title: Julia Child Wire: Today, on what would have been...
item.description: Today, on what would have been Julia Child's 102nd birthday, CNN publishes a list of lesser known facts about the woman who got Americans excited about French cuisine. While serving on the Secret Intelligence division of the OSS, she helped...

item.title: Seeing Iraq horror, Europe pledges aid and arms
item.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — The European Union on Friday forged a unified response to the rapid advance of Islamic militants in Iraq and the resulting refugee crisis, allowing direct arms deliveries to Kurdish fighters battling the Sunni insurgents, while several EU nations pledged more humanitarian aid.
item.media:text: BRUSSELS (AP) — The European Union on Friday forged a unified response to the rapid advance of Islamic militants in Iraq and the resulting refugee crisis, allowing direct arms deliveries to Kurdish fighters battling the Sunni insurgents, while several EU nations pledged more humanitarian aid.

item.title: Health workers make ultimate sacrifice to battle Ebola
item.description: Placed in a disinfected coffin and driven alongside two bagged bodies on a flatbed truck, Modupeh Cole is buried without ceremony, tribute or tears, far away from his loved ones. The eminent doctor, a specialist of some renown at the Connaught Hospital in Sierra Leone's capital Freetown, had been exposed to the deadly Ebola virus less than two weeks earlier. Examining a patient who, colleagues say, was the first case of Ebola in the hospital's 102-year history, he had no idea of the danger he was in. He was transferred to the specialist Ebola treatment centre run by global aid charity Medecins sans Frontieres (MSF) in the eastern town of Kailahun.
item.media:text: Placed in a disinfected coffin and driven alongside two bagged bodies on a flatbed truck, Modupeh Cole is buried without ceremony, tribute or tears, far away from his loved ones. The eminent doctor, a specialist of some renown at the Connaught Hospital in Sierra Leone's capital Freetown, had been exposed to the deadly Ebola virus less than two weeks earlier. Examining a patient who, colleagues say, was the first case of Ebola in the hospital's 102-year history, he had no idea of the danger he was in. He was transferred to the specialist Ebola treatment centre run by global aid charity Medecins sans Frontieres (MSF) in the eastern town of Kailahun.

item.title: AP video journalist mourned in Tuscan hometown
item.description: PITIGLIANO, Italy (AP) — Hundreds of mourners have packed the cathedral in this Tuscan hilltop town to remember Associated Press video journalist Simone Camilli, who was killed this week in the Gaza Strip.
item.media:text: PITIGLIANO, Italy (AP) — Hundreds of mourners have packed the cathedral in this Tuscan hilltop town to remember Associated Press video journalist Simone Camilli, who was killed this week in the Gaza Strip.

item.title: Congressman wants to curb military surplus program
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Images of police outfitted in paramilitary gear clashing with protesters in suburban St. Louis are giving new impetus to efforts to rein in a Pentagon program that provides free machine guns and other surplus military equipment to local law enforcement agencies.
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (AP) — Images of police outfitted in paramilitary gear clashing with protesters in suburban St. Louis are giving new impetus to efforts to rein in a Pentagon program that provides free machine guns and other surplus military equipment to local law enforcement agencies.

item.title: Missouri names officer in shooting of unarmed teen, cites robbery
item.description: By Nick Carey FERGUSON Mo. (Reuters) - Police named Darren Wilson as the officer who shot and killed an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Missouri, and said the youth was the key suspect in a robbery that occurred minutes before the shooting, which sparked days of sometimes violent protests. Wilson was the officer who shot and killed 18-year-old Michael Brown last Saturday, police said, giving in to pressure to identify the six-year veteran officer with a clean record, and to provide details about the investigation in order to ease tensions in the largely black suburb outside St. Louis. Two men, Brown and 22-year-old Dorian Johnson, entered the store and Brown became involved in a "struggle or confrontation" with someone else at the store, apparently over a box of cigars, a police report said. One page of the report named Brown as the "primary suspect in this incident," describing him as being dressed in khaki shorts, a white t-shirt and sporting a red baseball hat.
item.media:text: By Nick Carey FERGUSON Mo. (Reuters) - Police named Darren Wilson as the officer who shot and killed an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Missouri, and said the youth was the key suspect in a robbery that occurred minutes before the shooting, which sparked days of sometimes violent protests. Wilson was the officer who shot and killed 18-year-old Michael Brown last Saturday, police said, giving in to pressure to identify the six-year veteran officer with a clean record, and to provide details about the investigation in order to ease tensions in the largely black suburb outside St. Louis. Two men, Brown and 22-year-old Dorian Johnson, entered the store and Brown became involved in a "struggle or confrontation" with someone else at the store, apparently over a box of cigars, a police report said. One page of the report named Brown as the "primary suspect in this incident," describing him as being dressed in khaki shorts, a white t-shirt and sporting a red baseball hat.

item.title: Lesotho pull out of U20 qualifier over Ebola concerns
item.description: Lesotho said on Friday they have pulled out of this weekend's final 2015 African Youth Championship qualifier against Nigeria because of concerns about an outbreak of Ebola in the country. "We have contacted the Confederation of African Football (CAF) and copied the Nigeria Football Federation (NFF) that we will not be coming for this game," said Lesotho Football Federation official Limtho Mokhethi. African football's governing body CAF will now have to decide on the overall winners of the final qualifier, as a second leg in Lesotho is not expected to take place. The 2015 African Youth Championship will be played in Senegal from March 8.
item.media:text: Lesotho said on Friday they have pulled out of this weekend's final 2015 African Youth Championship qualifier against Nigeria because of concerns about an outbreak of Ebola in the country. "We have contacted the Confederation of African Football (CAF) and copied the Nigeria Football Federation (NFF) that we will not be coming for this game," said Lesotho Football Federation official Limtho Mokhethi. African football's governing body CAF will now have to decide on the overall winners of the final qualifier, as a second leg in Lesotho is not expected to take place. The 2015 African Youth Championship will be played in Senegal from March 8.

item.title: Celebrity Real Estate: Christie Brinkley's Unreal Caribbean Digs Are Up for $9M
item.description: Apparently renting out her absolutely perfect place on the Turks and Caicos Islands (for $8,107 a day!) is no longer enough for model Christie Brinkley, who wants out of her "Lucky House"...

item.title: Ebola may leave 1 million in need of food help
item.description: CONAKRY, Guinea (AP) — The deadly Ebola virus that has killed more than 1,000 in West Africa is disrupting the flow of goods, forcing the United Nations to plan food convoys for up to a million people as hunger threatens the largely impoverished area.
item.media:text: CONAKRY, Guinea (AP) — The deadly Ebola virus that has killed more than 1,000 in West Africa is disrupting the flow of goods, forcing the United Nations to plan food convoys for up to a million people as hunger threatens the largely impoverished area.

item.title: Ferguson police ID officer in shooting
item.description: Darren Wilson was policeman involved. Jason Sickles on the scene.
item.media:text: Darren Wilson was policeman involved. Jason Sickles on the scene.

item.title: Try commuting in this three-wheeler
item.description: ROYAL OAK, Mich. (AP) — Your next commuter car could have two seats, three wheels and get 84 miles to the gallon.
item.media:text: ROYAL OAK, Mich. (AP) — Your next commuter car could have two seats, three wheels and get 84 miles to the gallon.
